ygData.subject: Re: fPIC problem on 64-bit RH Enterprise Linux 5
ygData.msgSnippet: I had a similar problem installing Cantera on a 64-bit Ubuntu system, and found that compiling Sundials with -fPIC solved my problems, i.e. run the configure

I had a similar problem installing Cantera on a 64-bit Ubuntu system,
and f=
ound that compiling Sundials with -fPIC solved my problems, i.e.
run the co=
nfigure script for sundials with the options
--with-cflags=3D-fPIC --with-c=
ppflags=3D-fPIC

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Mirko" <mvukovic@...> wro=
te:
>
> Hi,
> 
> I downloaded cantera 1.7.0 yesterday from sourceforge.
> 
=
> I get an error when running "make python-install" with the message
> that=
 I need to recompile with -fPIC.
> 
> I have seen several emails with the s=
ame topic.  But some of them
> indicate that the problem was resolved in ve=
rsion 1.7.1.  Where can I
> find that version (I looked briefly at the CVS =
and did not see
> anything newer than 1.7, except for Makefile.in)?
> 
> (I=
 am not super-comfortable modifying the makefiles, but with clear
> enough =
instructions I am willing to do it).
> 
> In case it is of relevance, I thi=
nk I have 64-bit python, simply
> because my python2.4 sits in the /usr/lib=
64 directory.  (It came
> pre-installed)
> 
> Thank you very much,
> 
> Mir=
ko
>
